author: Omar Rashid
text:
SP accuses Modi government of deceiving people of Uttar Pradesh

The first list of Smart Cities released by the Centre on Thursday did not include any city from Uttar Pradesh, which goes to the polls next year.

Opposition parties criticised the Centre for excluding cities in Uttar Pradesh from Smart Cities Mission questioning its commitment to the people of the State.

The ruling Samajwadi Party accused the Narendra Modi government of cheating the people of Uttar Pradesh, which gave the BJP 71 MPs (out of the 80 seats in the State) in the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. Cabinet Minister and SP spokesperson Rajendra Chaudhary accused the BJP government of deceiving the people of Uttar Pradesh.

BSP leader Swami Prasad Maurya said it reiterated the Centre’s “stepmotherly treatment” and “indifference” towards the State. Uttar Pradesh sent a list of 13 cities for development as Smart Cities, the maximum for any State.
title: U.P. fumes as it fails to enter smart list
